data.question: What is the electronic configuration of cobalt(III) complexes?
How many pentacoordinate complexes of {CoIII(N)5(X)n} species are reported in the CSD?
What type of ligand produces stable CoII as well as five- and six-coordinate CoIII complexes?
What is the effect of the bispidine derivatives L1a and L2a on the coordination of CoIII complexes?
data.answer: They only produce the usual six-coordinate CoIII complexes

data.question: What unusual geometry was revealed in the crystal-structural analysis of [Cu(L2)]2+?
data.answer: Elongation of the Nar1–Cu–Nar2 bonds and short metal–donor bonds to N3, N7, and Npy3

data.question: What stabilizes the intermediate-spin electronic state in CoIII complexes?
data.answer: The decrease of the energy gap between the t2g and eg orbitals

data.question: What is the role of the bispidine ligands in CoIII coordination chemistry?
data.answer: They enforce structure and properties by facilitating switching between coordination numbers and electronic structures

data.question: Why do CoIII complexes exhibit unusual reactivities?
data.answer: Due to their interesting coordination geometries and electronic structures

data.question: How can the relative stabilities of CoIII complexes be tuned?
data.answer: Through simple ligand modifications, such as the substitution of the a-position of py3

data.question: What causes the repulsive interaction in the complexes of L1 and L2?
data.answer: The interaction between ar1,2 and py3

data.question: What is the significance of the open N7–M–Npy3 angle in CoIII and CuII complexes?
data.answer: It creates a strong repulsive interaction leading to an elongation of the M–X bond

data.question: How were the hypotheses regarding CoIII complexes confirmed?
True or False: Hexaamine CoIII complexes have a high-spin d6 electronic configuration.
True or False: The bispidine ligands have no effect on the electronic structure of CoIII complexes.
True or False: The study of first-row transition-metal coordination chemistry revealed no interesting properties.
True or False: The CoIII complexes of L1 and L2 are always pentacoordinate.
True or False: The DFT approach used in the study was confirmed by poor agreement between computed and experimental structures.
True or False: The intermediate-spin pentacoordinate CoIII complex of L1 is always lower in energy than the low-spin hexacoordinate state.
True or False: The complexes of L1 and L2 with smaller chelate rings involving Npy3 exhibit unusual coordination geometries.
